item.title: Winning
item.description:
if you find a thing
that is so that

whoever has it
can’t keep it

and

whoever doesn’t have it
can always get it back

then this a thing
that is to be avoided
in the beginning

item.title: Poetry
item.description:
collect your grief
and inject it
in words

spill them on paper
and shred it to tatters
to piece yourself together

item.title: Letting Go
item.description:
ख्वाब हे वो माशूका
जो तुझे मिलने से रहा,
हकीकत हे वो हमसफर
जिसे तुने है ठुकरा दिया

सपनों का घर है नींदो मे
उन्हे वहीं तू छोड दे
जो हकीकत सम्झोता लगे
वहीं सुकून है जान ले

A dream is an elusive enchantment;
while that that is to be treasured
is what has been for real
and is easily ignored.

But a mere figment of imagination,
a dream is captive and binding:
let it go to be free from
your quest never-ending.

Inspired by Pallavi Mahajan’s brilliant poetry.

item.title: Dad
item.description:
The vendor
at the counter
hands me a stapler,
wondering why
I need yet another.

Indeed, I didn’t,
until I realized

that she giggles
when I get frantic
about lost pencils,
papers, and staplers

and she smiles
indignantly
whenever I look,
exasperated,

at her tiny hands
clutched around
the stuff she found.

I am just bringing home
another situation
inviting her indignation,

that eventually
turns into
a bear hug
of pure love.

item.title: On the Fence
item.description:
At least you are dead.
To which the ghost said,
The grass is not greener here -
But it did become paler there…

At least you have a chance,
To wait for the rains’ dance,
To live and fight,
To make things right.

item.title: Sprinkles of the Sky
item.description:
A dubious draft of air
comes, goes
as if wondering
if the air’s welcoming

Soft rays tiptoe
by the window
as if shy
to come inside

Sprinkles of the sky
lie in drops of dew
as if captive,
somewhat pensive

And I snuggle deeper
into a distant dream
as if I could see
a better place to be

I stole the title from a phrase in Hairat, a song that features in Anjaana Anjaani. Incidentally - I am very addicted to the entire album!

item.title: Seek
item.description:
Seek poetry
in a wisp of smoke,
or closure
in some ashes

stories below
newspaper headlines
peace after
bygone deadlines

a castle
in the air
a choice
that is fair

the absence of regret
on a death bed
a reason, or otherwise
to stay alive —

and quite likely
it will be
a quest unfulfilled.

Find a smile instead,
and you will find
some strength to stay
another day.

item.title: Bloom
item.description:
Velvet-like violet
erupts
in a riot
on miniscule
white canvases
harp-like;
focused at
a bunch of seeds.

All trouble
to no avail,
one day the bee will come
and take it all away.

Honorable Mention in the The Binnacle Second Annual Ultra Short Competition.
